ARTICLE.TITLE: Ismail Sabri: 75 fined, 11 arrested for breaching MCO
ARTICLE.TEXT:
KUALA LUMPUR: Seventy-five people were issued with compounds while 11 others were arrested for violating the recovery movement control order (MCO), says Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob (pic).

The Senior Minister (Security) said among the offences committed on Friday (Aug 21) were failure to prepare temperature checks, not wearing face masks and taking part in activities that hampered social distancing.

"The operation compliance task force led by the police also performed 60,918 checks to ensure that the public complied with existing standard operating procedures.

"Among the locations checked were 3,988 supermarkets, 5,188 restaurants and 3,617 banks," he said in a statement on Saturday (Aug 22).

On Ops Benteng, Ismail said the police conducted 63 roadblocks nationwide on Friday.

"A total of 28,729 vehicles were checked," he added.

On another matter, Ismail Sabri said a total of 9,694 public sanitisation operations were conducted nationwide since March 30.

"A total of 12,867 premises have been sanitised involving 134 zones.

"Among the premises were 2,699 business centres, 5,662 government buildings and 1,594 housing estates," he added.
